etymologies: mid 19th century: modern Latin, from poly-‘many’ + -cyte‘cell’ + hemo-‘blood’ + -ia

definitions: an abnormally increased concentration of hemoglobin in the blood, through either reduction of plasma volume or increase in red cell numbers. It may be a primary disease of unknown cause, or a secondary condition linked to respiratory or circulatory disorder or cancer.
shortDefinitions: abnormally increased concentration of haemoglobin in blood, either through reduction of plasma volume or increase
